item.title: When The New Wing Broke Away from the Old Mansion
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franzen
item.description: Once there was a mansion in which there lived five brothers.

item.title: The Republic of Bad Taste
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franzen
item.description: The church on Siegfeldstrasse was open to anyone who embarrassed the Republic, and Andreas Wolf was so much of an embarrassment that he actually resided there

item.title: How He Came To Be Nowhere
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franzen
item.description: Room 471, the Federal Building, Eighth Street, Philadelphia: a perfectly square room which for no obvious reason had an eye chart on the southern wall.

item.title: Chez Lambert
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franzen
item.description: Enid and Alfred are an older couple who have lived together for many years and yet each has their own tendencies and imperfections.

item.title: Jonathan Franzen, The Art of Fiction No.207
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franzen, Stephen J. Burn
item.description: Jonathan Franzen’s fiction bears the mark of a Midwest upbringing, his books preoccupied with quiet lives.

item.title: Baader-Meinhof
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franzen
item.description: She knew there was someone else in the room. There was no outright noise, just an intimation behind her, a faint displacement of air.

item.title: Breakup Stories
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franzen
item.description: Our friend Danni’s young husband had been intending, since before he was her husband, to talk about his feelings about having children

item.title: Two's Company
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franzen
item.description: And then the perfect couple, Pam and Paul, who first hooked up in college, co-writing operettas and co-founding a cabaret, went on to amaze their classmates by marrying in Reno.

item.title: Human Moments in World War III
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franzen
item.description: A note about Vollmer. He no longer describes the earth as a library globe or a map that has come alive, as a cosmic eye staring into deep space.

item.title: Good Neighbors
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franzen
item.description: Walter and Patty Berglund were the young pioneers of Ramsey Hill—the first college grads to buy a house on Barrier Street.

item.title: Agreeable
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franzen
item.description: If Patty hadn’t been an atheist, she might have thanked the good Lord for school athletic programs, because they basically saved her life
